title: Puerto Rican Sancocho
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds beef stew meat, cut into small pieces
1 cup chopped fresh green beans, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces
1  large chayote squash - peeled, cored, and sliced lengthwise
1 (15.5 ounce) can small white beans, rinsed and drained
1  green banana, peeled and sliced into 3/4-inch pieces
1  yellow plantain, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
2 ears fresh corn, sliced into 6 pieces each
⅓ cup chopped green bell pepper
method: Step 2: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-low heat. Add onion, garlic, cilantro, white pepper, oregano, and salt. Cook and stir until onion is browned and very tender, about 20 minutes.
Step 3: Add stew meat; cook and stir until meat is browned on all sides, 5 to 7 minutes.
Step 4: Pour enough water over meat mixture to fill the pot 3/4 full. Add tomato sauce and beef bouillon.

Step 5: Stir in the remaining ingredients, one at a time, cooking slightly after each addition in the following order: green beans, carrots, celery, chayote squash, white beans, cabbage, green banana, yellow plantain, llautias, potatoes, pumpkin, corn, and green bell pepper.
Step 6: Cook until all the vegetables are tender and stew has formed a rich broth, 2 to 3 hours. Add more water or salt if needed.
